title: cottonee
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #546 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Grass/Fairy Pokémon. Prior to Generation VI, it was a pure Grass type.
Cottonee is a white, circular Pokémon. It has white, puffy sections on the top of its head and its underside. Behind it is a green, star shaped section similar to the area where a plant connects to its produce. It has orange, oval-shaped eyes, and furled, notched leaves on the sides of its body.

It evolves into [[Whimsicott]] via [i]Sun Stone[/i].
Japanese Name: [b]Monmen[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Scolipede]]
Next Pokémon: [[Whimsicott]]

title: heimlich_maneuver
body:
[i]"Abdominal thrusts (also called the Heimlich maneuver or Heimlich manoeuvre [...]) is a first aid procedure used to treat upper airway obstructions (or choking) by foreign objects. [...] Performing abdominal thrusts involves a rescuer standing behind a patient and using his or her hands to exert pressure on the bottom of the diaphragm. This compresses the lungs and exerts pressure on any object lodged in the trachea, hopefully expelling it."[/i]

- Wikipedia

Subjects of the Heimlich Maneuver are almost always choking. Not to be mistaken with [[cpr]], cardiopulmonary resuscitation, which attempts to artificially produce heart beats by pumping the chest area with both hands.

title: fuchibeppu_chiyuri
body:
A [[huge breasts|large]], [[plump|heavy-set]] young lady with an apathetic and lethargic demeanor, which is reflected in her constant [[half-closed eyes]] and her verbal tic, where she drops syllables in nearly every sentence. She also doesn't seem to mind her nameless boyfriend's constant [[groping|physical attention]].

Her appearance is based off of the [[Tibetan Sand Fox]], though she isn't technically one herself. She is usually drawn without a [[tail]], and while her [[pointy hair]]style resembles [[fox ears]], they might not necessarily be ears at all.

Her author of origin is (currently) unknown. [[tsukudani (coke-buta)]] and [[fukumaaya]] are the two candidates, and it's possible that they both created her.

title: futhark
body:
A northern Germanic [[runes|runic]] script, characterized by their straight lines due to their supposed derivation from tossing divination twigs or bones and reading the patterns where they land.  The elder variant was transplanted into Britain during the Saxon invasion, while the younger variation was used by the Vikings.  

Made famous among CRPG circles by their use in the [[Ultima]] series of games, Futhark runes are a go-to rune for something meant to be obscure but also recognizably Western and Medieval. 

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia article on Elder Futhark":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elder_Futhark]
* "Wikipedia article on Younger Futhark":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Younger_Futhark]

title: christine_von_lerchenfeld
body:
One of the main heroine's of the Visual Novel Honoo no Haramase Motto! Hatsuiku! Shintai Sokutei 2
Voiced by: Aoba Ringo
Description
Grade: First Year
Height: 165.5cm
Three Sizes: B109.0 (S-cup) / W58 / H95
Affiliation: Valhalla Knights
Attributes: Noble and neat woman knight, childhood friend
Problems: Goes into a state of estrus when looking at swords, because they remind her of male genitals.
Erogenous Zone(s): Anal, underarms
Befitting of a knight, she is the nobly beautiful daughter of the Earl of the house of Lerchenfeld.
Her prowess as a knight is not only impressive, but her bust size is unmatched by any other.
She is an ambitious, non-conceited hard-worker. And her fighting style also has an aggressive side, which is achieved by shortening the distance between the her and the opponent instantly.
Since she's helped Shunosuke since they were children, she has always revered him.
Her all time favorite food is the hamburger, and she seems to evoke the effect of the more "invites" to Valhalla, referring to it as a "deadly hamburger".

title: heartbreak_haircut
body:
The act of [[cutting_hair|cutting one's hair]], usually by oneself, after a breakup. Can be seen as a form of therapy after heartbreak by "starting fresh".

Signs include the hair cutting being self-afflicted, coupled with a [[sad]] or [[angry]] expression.

title: lotta_svaerd
body:
Lotta Svärd was a Finnish voluntary auxiliary paramilitary organisation for women formed originally in 1918. The organisation inspired similar organisations in Sweden (Lottorna), Denmark and Norway.

title: sekai_(karakuri_shoujo)
body:
Japanese: 世界 (せかい) [Sekai]

Original character of [[nakano_futaba]], for "世回転界クロジカル (よかいけんたいくろじかる)" AKA "World-Rolling Black Logical" under series name 空狂少女 (からくりしょうじょ / [[karakuri_shoujo|Karakuri Shoujo]]), also written as "カラクリガールシリーズ [Karakuri Girls Series]". 

"Profile image":/posts/2554427

Information comes from her profile on "Uchi no Ko-Mato":https://www.uchinokomato.me/chara/show/3993 (stands for うちの子まと/うちのこまとめ [Uchi no Ko Matome]):

h4.Profile 

* [b]Quote[/b]: I don't know anything about the world
* [b]Name in Furigana[/b]: せかい (Sekai)
* [b]Works Appeared In[/b]: World-Rolling Black Logical
* [b]Age[/b]: appears to be 14 years old
* [b]Gender[/b]: Female
* [b]Height[/b]: 150cm
* [b]Weight[/b]: 40kg
* [b]First-person pronouns (personal pronoun)[/b]: Sekai (see "Wikipedia":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%97%A5%E6%9C%AC%E8%AA%9E%E3%81%AE%E4%B8%80%E4%BA%BA%E7%A7%B0%E4%BB%A3%E5%90%8D%E8%A9%9E#.E8.A9.B1.E8.80.85.E3.81.AE.E5.90.8D.E5.89.8D on use of name as first-person pronoun), watashi / 私
* [b]Second-person pronoun (referring to others)[/b]: [Name]-san / 名前(さん)

h4. Biography

Main heroine. Amber and sky-blue long hair, with cherry blossom pink pupils. (Because her hair has something like "structural coloration":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Structural_coloration, it shines gold when the light hits upon it strongly, and has a tinge of blue where it doesn't.)
She talks in a manner like "-hoyo?", "hawawa", "~nano desu".
[tn]Because there is no direct English equivalent for these, I left them as is.[/tn]

She is a girl who came down from the sky and met Misaki. 

She has a perfect appearance, like that of a doll:
* according to [[misaki_otome|Masaki Otome]] it's something like this — "In eighteen years of living, I've never seen a girl like this. Her cuteness is something that cannot be expressed in words"
* has a face very closely resembling [[rourin|Rourin]]'s, and was both looked over and intimidated by her. She has said that in order to escape from her, it wouldn't be overdoing it to hide in a room where light could never reach. 

Referring to them as "vessels", she is in pursuit of every human being. 
She is hiding an unhuman ability. 
"...I don't know, I'm sorry"

With an innocent, absent-minded impression, she isn't sure what she should do or wants to do and so seems like a doll-like girl with nothing in her. 
Nonetheless, she isn't indifferent; she is openly moved by even small things, and shows a variety of expressions.

Contrary to her apparent age, her mental age is much younger. 

__

After leaving for this outside world and meeting Misaki and the others, experiencing and learning lots of things, eventually she was able to find her own purpose. 
In regards to Misaki, since Misaki was the first person she encountered in this outside world she considers herself indebted to her and thinks of her as her beloved, most important person. 


Full of emotion and brimming with curiosity, she is more or less a clumsy girl. Basically, she's a friendly person and smiles at everyone. 
Being absent-minded, there are times when one isn't sure what she's thinking about, but generally she herself is naturally an airhead who doesn't really think about anything. 
She also occasionally has the initiative to straight-out tell you what she's thinking. 

Due to her trauma from being locked up for many years and her anxiety that her body being taken over by Rourin, she has a relentless fear of "I will be lost". 

[spoiler]She is a clone of "Air":https://www.uchinokomato.me/chara/show/12785.
It's only been a small amount of time since she gained consciousness, and because she escaped without knowing anything, she remains innocent/ignorant.
She fled from Rourin, who was using the "key of the world" entrusted to her by Noel, and came along to Misaki by chance.[/spoiler]

She likes the blue sky, high-up places where you can see the sky well, and animals. She's good at climbing trees.
She dislikes/is bad with dark, enclosed places. She is particularly afraid of the dark. 

It seems like she is able to communicate with animals. The reason is unknown. She also makes friends with animals easily.

title: maou_juvenile_remix
body:
Manga serialized in Shounen Sunday based on the novel of Isaka Koutarou (伊坂 幸太郎). Its author and illustrator is Oosuga Megumi (大須賀 めぐみ). Isaka Koutarou has a novel named "Grasshopper" (グラスホッパー) after the antagonistic organization depicted in the manga.

h3. Characters

h4. Protagonists
* The older [[Andou (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Andou]] (安藤, given name unknown) - Protagonist of the first part. Resident of the fictional Nekota city (based in Kanto region) and a second-year student at Nekota East High. He didn't agree with Inukai's way to change the world and fought against his group, the Grasshopper.
* [[Andou Junya]] (安藤 潤也) - Younger brother of Andou and protagonist of the second part. Another character from the novel "Modern Times" (モダンタイムス), set in the same world in 50 years later, Andou Shoukai (安藤 商会) is his descendant.

h4. Grasshopper (グラスホッパー Gurasuhoppā)
* [[Inukai Shunji]] (犬養 舜二) - The main antagonist of the series and the founder and leader of the Grasshopper, an influencing organization with many relations in the Japanese political world. He is the charismatic person who can manipulate many people.
* [[Master (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Master]] (マスター) - The master of cafe Duce (ドゥーチェ).
* [[Tatsumi Masachika]] (辰美 将至) - A politian who allies with the Grasshopper and later becomes the Mayor of Nekota city.
* Suzumebachi - See Assassins reference.
* [[Nakamura Tarou]] (中村 太郎) - The former leader of his gang "Cat" (キャット). Later joins Grasshopper after receiving the beating and manipulating by Inukai and his men.
* [[Kaname (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Kaname]] (要) - A boy who is the classmate of the older Andou. He was a bully victim before being contacted with Inukai.

h4. Nekota East High (猫田東高校)
* [[Shima (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Shima]] (島) - Andou's friend in Nekota Highschool.
* [[Shiori (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Shiori]] (詩織) - Junya's girlfriend. She later appears in the novel "Modern Times" (モダンタイムス) by Isaka Koutarou, set in 50 years later of Maou Juvenile Remix, and visited by the novel protagonist Watanabe (渡辺).
* [[Machiko (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Machiko]] (満智子) - A beautiful girl who is a third-year student and president of Nekota High's Newspaper club in which the Andou brothers are members.
* [[Anderson Jr (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Anderson Jr.]] (アンダーソンJr., given name unknown) - An half-American half-Japanese student who later attends the same class with the older Andou. Due to Inukai's influences, Nekota residents' rage for the Anderson Group (a company managed by his father) intensely increase which make Anderson's classmates and other students behave violently towards the younger Anderson.
* Kaname - See Grasshopper refernce.
* [[Hirata (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Hirata]] (平田) - President of Nekota High's Newspaper Club, though the main authority falls into Machiko's hands.
* [[Karasumi (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Karasumi]] (唐墨) - A bully.
* [[Mitsuyo (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Mitsuyo]] (蜜代) - Shiori's friend.
* [[Mitsuyo's boyfriend]] (蜜代の彼氏) - Beardy boyfriend of Mitsuyo.

h4. Assassins
* [[Semi (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Semi]] (蝉, "Cicada") - An assassin first sent to kill the older Andou, but spared him instead because of his assassination contract being cancelled. A character from the novel "Grasshopper" (グラスホッパー) by Isaka Koutarou.
* [[Iwanishi (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Iwanishi]] (岩西) - The boss of Semi. A character from the novel "Grasshopper" by Isaka Koutarou.
* [[Kujira (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Kujira]] (鯨, "Whale") - A character from the novel "Grasshopper "by Isaka Koutarou.
* [[Suzumebachi (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Suzumebachi]] (スズメバチ, "Hornet") - An assassin hired by Mr. Anderson to kill a great number of members of Grasshopper. A character from the novel "Grasshopper" by Isaka Koutarou, her young days are depicted in the spin-off Waltz.
* Two killers hired by Anderson to kill the former mayor before Tatsumi.
* [[Asagao (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Asagao]] (槿) - A character from the novel Grasshopper and its sequel Maria-Beatle (マリアビートル) by Isaka Koutarou.
* Two snipers, formerly part of the army, hired by Fraulein to snipe Inukai.

h4. Informer
* [[Momo (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Momo]] (桃) - The informer doing business with Iwanishi and Semi. A character from the novel "Grasshopper" by Isaka Koutarou.
* Man in black - The formerly intended "Maou" of the series, but later changed to Andou Junya. Believed to appear in another novel by Isaka Koutarou "Accuracy of Death" (死神の精度).

h4. Troupe
* [[Kentarou (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Kentarou]] (健太郎) and [[Koujirou (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Koujirou]] (孝次郎) - The twin brothers who can use ESP since their young age. Characters from the novel "Grasshopper" by Isaka Koutarou.
* [[Wife of Asagao]] (槿の妻) - Wife of Asagao and mother of the twins. A character from the novel "Grasshopper" by Isaka Koutarou.

h4. Fraulein (フロイライン Furoirain)
aka. <Reijou> (<令嬢>, "Maiden")
* [[Terahara (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Terahara]] (寺原, given name unknown) - President of Fraulein. A character from the novel "Grasshopper" by Isaka Koutarou.
* [[Terahara Jr|Terahara Junior]] (寺原ジュニア, given name unknown) - Son of the president of Fraulein. A character from the novel "Grasshopper" by Isaka Koutarou.
* [[Hiyoko (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Hiyoko]] (比与子) - A character from the novel "Grasshopper" by Isaka Koutarou.
* Three of Fraulein employees were killed by Semi. Other of them can be found in the novel "Modern Times" by Isaka Koutarou.
* Four of the officials hired by Terahara Jr. to "hunt" four of Junya's friends: Machiko, Mitsuyo, Mitsuyo's boyfriend, and Shiori. Later, they were killed by Semi.

h4. Authorities of Nekota city
* [[Nekota Police Detective]] (刑事) - The detective with the moustache who seems to be in odd with Inukai and does not agree with his actions.
* [[Nekota City Mayor|Mayor]] (市長) - The fat cowardly former mayor of Nekota city. He later is confronted with Kujira, and despite Semi's protection, he is hypnotized to suicide by jumping off his room's balcony.
* [[Mr. Anderson (Maou Juvenile Remix)|Mr. Anderson]] (Mr.アンダーソン, given name unknown) - An American influencing businessman and president of the Anderson Group who wants to make his project building the "New City" in Nekota city.
* [[Yamamoto Miyuki]] (山本 みゆき) - A man of the Nekota city council. Hypnotized to suicide by Kujira.
other_names: まおう・ジュブナイル・リミックス

title: project_diva_extend
body:
h4. Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- extend

h6. 初音ミク -Project DIVA- extend
The 3rd entry in the game series published by [[SEGA]], featuring virtual idol [[Hatsune Miku]] and her fellow [[Vocaloid]]s.

Released on November 10, 2011, this was the last game in the series to be released on the [[Playstation Portable]].

h5. Official site:

* "Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- extend":http://miku.sega.jp/extend/

title: project_diva_f
body:
h4. Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- f (Vita)/Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- F (PS3)

h6. 初音ミク -Project DIVA- ƒ/初音ミク -Project DIVA- Ƒ
The 4th game of the [[project_diva_(series)|Project DIVA]] series published by [[SEGA]], featuring virtual idol [[Hatsune Miku]] and her fellow [[Vocaloid]]s. Released on August 30, 2012 for the [[Playstation Vita]], and March 7, 2013 for the [[Playstation 3]], this version of the game received a graphic overhaul and new features including a "Scratch" command (using the touch screen (Vita)/analog sticks (PS3) when a ☆ appears on the screen), up to 3 characters on stage, and a more interactive DIVA Room. Missing notes also causes the vocals to cut out; a feature that was removed from DIVA 2nd and extend due to size restrictions. The PS3 release is the same as the Vita version, with additional songs and modules added to the game.

h5. Official sites:

* "Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- f":http://miku.sega.jp/f/
* "Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- F":http://miku.sega.jp/f/ps3/

title: project_diva_f_2nd
body:
h4. Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- F 2nd

h6. 初音ミク -Project DIVA- Ƒ 2nd
The 5th game of the [[project_diva_(series)|Project DIVA]] series published by [[SEGA]], featuring virtual idol [[Hatsune Miku]] and her fellow [[Vocaloid]]s. Designed on the theme of "DIVA until now" and "DIVA from here on", this installment features remakes of songs and modules from the previous Project DIVA games that were released on the [[Playstation Portable]], as well as brand new songs and modules.

Unlike the previous F, this game was released on the [[Playstation 3]] and [[Playstation Vita]] simultaneously on March 27, 2014.

h5. Official site:

* "Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- F 2nd":http://miku.sega.jp/f2/

title: terra_battle
body:
A mobile strategy RPG for smartphone by MISTWALKER (led by the creator of [[Final Fantasy]] Hironobu Sakaguchi), released on October 9th, 2014. The game features many big Square-associated names such as Nobuo Uematsu.

MISTWALKER is running a "Download Starter" for the game where the number of downloads for the game will determine content being unlocked such as artists creating new art, new game models, and the production of books and figurines. The two million downloads benchmark will start development of a console version of the game.

h4.See also

h6.Official site: http://www.terra-battle.com/en/

h6. Official twitter: https://twitter.com/terra_battle_en

h6. MISTWALKER official YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/MISTWALKERChannel/

title: william_george_tennant
body:
A Royal Navy officer, known as the captain of [[HMS Repulse]] at the time "she was sunk":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinking_of_Prince_of_Wales_and_Repulse]. He was rescued by "HMAS Vampire":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAS_Vampire_%28D68%29] and later aided in the setup of the "Mulberry harbours":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mulberry_harbour during the Allied invasion of Normandy.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Tennant_%28Royal_Navy_officer%29]
* [[Tag Group:People]]
other_names: ウィリアム・テナント

title: time_bokan_24
body:
The tenth installment of the [i][[Time Bokan (Series)|Time Bokan]][/i] series, meant to celebrate [[Tatsunoko Pro|Tatsunoko Production]]'s 55th anniversary. Protagonists [[tokio_(time_bokan)|Tokio]] and [[calen_(time_bokan)|Calen]] must travel through time and  set history to its true state while battling against the Akudarma trio, who fight to keep history the same as in their company's textbooks.

title: prism
body:
A geometrical figure with volume counting with a pair of parallel bases.
The most evocative prism has triangular bases (e.g. Post #742744). It is popular because of its ability to create [[rainbow|rainbows]] out of ordinary (polichromatic) light.

h5. Clarification

Cubes [b]are[/b] prisms too, but those  are better off tagged as [[cube|cubes]].
Pyramids [b]are not[/b] prisms.

title: inari_konkon_koi_iroha.
body:
Inari, Konkon, Koi Iroha is Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Yoshida Morohe]], which began serialization in Kadokawa Shoten's Young Ace magazine from August 2010. A television anime adaptation by Production IMS began airing in Japan from January 15, 2014.

h4. Characters

* [[Fushimi Inari]]
* [[uka-no-mitama-no-kami_(inakon)|Uka-no-Mitama-no-Kami]]
* [[Fushimi Touka]]
* [[Marutamachi Chika]]
* [[Sanjou Keiko]]
* [[Sumizome Akemi]]
* [[Tanbabashi Kouji]]
* [[Oomiya-no-Me-no-Kami]]
* [[ootoshi-no-kami_(inakon)|Ootoshi-no-Kami]]
* [[kon (inakon)|Kon]]
* [[shishi (inakon)|Shishi]] and [[roro (inakon)|Roro]]


h4. External links

title: rueken's_elona_player_character
body:
Because players make unique player characters in [[Elona]], including selecting customized sprites, every player's character looks different.  [[harusame_(rueken)|Harusame]] seems to use one design for player characters rather frequently, however.

Rueken's Player Character has [[green hair]], sometimes in [[twin braids]], and a red dress.  This makes her look like a bigger version of [[Younger Sister (Elona)]], and often one or the other is wielding a [[mace]].

title: mirai_robo_daltanious
body:
[b]Mirai Robo Daltanious[/b] (未来ロボ ダルタニアス [i]Mirai Robo Darutaniasu[/i]), also known as [b]Future Robot Daltanious[/b], is a [[science fiction]] and [[super robot]] anime TV series which aired from 1979 to 1980 in Japan.

Nagahama Tadao influenced the series' artistry and direction, and its style resembles those of [[Choudenji Machine Voltes V]] and [[Choudenji Robo Combattler V]].

h4. See also

* [[Daltanious]]
* [[Shiratori Sanae]]
other_names: 未来ロボダルタニアス

title: dragon's_crown
body:
A 2-D Multiplayer Real-Time Action Role-Playing video game released in 2013 for [[PlayStation 3]] and [[PlayStation Vita]]. Published by Ignition Entertainment, it is considered a spiritual successor to previous games by the developer, [[Vanillaware]] (headed by founder and lead artist [[Kamitani George]]), including [i][[Princess Crown]][/i], [i][[Odin Sphere]][/i], and [i][[Oboro Muramasa]][/i]

Remarkable due to how much fanart the game spawned despite not being released for several years after character art was posted.

h4. Characters

* [[Amazon (Dragon's Crown)|Amazon]]
* [[Dwarf (Dragon's Crown)|Dwarf]]
* [[Elf (Dragon's Crown)|Elf]]
* [[Fighter (Dragon's Crown)|Fighter]]
* [[Sorceress (Dragon's Crown)|Sorceress]]
* [[Wizard (Dragon's Crown)|Wizard]]

h4. Allies

* [[rannie_(dragon's_crown)|Loni the Thief/Rogue]] (NA: Rannie the Rogue)

title: demono_crusade
body:
Japanese puzzle RPG game.

Tatsumi Electronics made a large update of the game [[Fantasy Drop]] by renewing the whole game. To celebrate Fantasy Drop's 2nd anniversary, they re-opened the game on october 2016 with a pre-register campaign.

The large update contains a new game title ([[DEMONO CRUSADE -Fantasy drop-]]), a story, and in addition to the 250 existing anima, 50 more are added. Brust mode and auto mode are implemented in battle system, achievement system and a whole new evolution system is also added. With a new evolution system you can change some characters appearance from angel to devil.

h4. Links
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/FantasyDrop_JP
* "Website":http://fantasydrop.jp/

title: snake_eyez
body:
Real name: [b]Darryl Lewis[/b]

An American fighting game player originally from Irvine, California, known as one of the best [[Zangief]] players in the world in [[street_fighter_iv_(series)|Street Fighter IV]] and [[Street Fighter V]]. He is a one-time [[Evolution Championship Series|Evolution]] champion, for [[street_fighter_ii_(series)|Super Street Fighter II Turbo HD Remix]] in 2010, but he is arguably even more known for his reverse OCV (reverse one-character victory) for Wednesday Night Fights against Team NorCal at SoCal Regionals 2014, where he defeated the entire Northern California team (including Ricki Ortiz and PR Balrog) when he was the only player left on Team WNF.

title: umehara_daigo
body:
[b]Daigo Umehara[/b] ([b]梅原 大吾[/b] [i]Umehara Daigo[/i], born 19 May 1981), is a renowned Japanese arcade fighting video game player. He specializes in 2D arcade fighting games, mainly those released by [[Capcom]]. Known as "Daigo" or "The Beast" in the west and "Umehara" or "Ume" in Japan, Umehara is being hailed as the world's most famous [[Street Fighter]] player or the greatest Street Fighter player, he currently holds a world record of "the most successful player in major tournaments of Street Fighter" in Guinness World Records.

h4. [[Evo moment #37|The Dramatic Comeback]]

Umehara started becoming famous internationally from the YouTube video clips of his match in the Losers bracket final in [[Evolution Championship Series]] 2004's [[street_fighter_iii_(series)|Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike]] competition where he made a dramatic comeback against [[Justin Wong (gamer)|Justin Wong]]'s [[Chun-Li]]. In the final round of match 1, Umehara's [[ken masters|Ken]] was down to his last pixel of vitality. At this point, any special attack would knock Umehara's character out if connected, since special attacks deal chip damage even when blocked. In an attempt to win the round, Wong attempted to hit Umehara's Ken with Chun-Li's multihit Super Art move "Hou Yoku Sen" (鳳翼扇). However, instead of avoiding it, Umehara chose to "Parry," a technique whereby an incoming attack is blocked without the player losing any health, but by doing so requires moving toward opponent's direction in the same time a hit lands, within four of thirty frames per second of the impact animation. After the move was launched, not only were all 15 hits Parried, but Umehara also managed to get into a good position to make a powerful attacking combo that knocked Chun-Li out instead. This moment was recorded and later spread on the Internet, gaining immense popularity.

NHK's TV program, MAG-NET, has called this moment "Kiseki no Gyakuten Geki" (奇跡の逆転劇) or "The miraculous reversal play".

title: salazzle
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #758 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Fire/Poison Pokémon. 

Salazzle is a dark grey Pokémon resembling a salamander or a lizard. It has a thin dark grey body with a purple underside. Its head is dark grey with purple eyes and slit pupils.

Only female [[Salandit]] will evolve into a Salazzle.

Japanese name: [b]Ennyūto[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Salandit]]
Next Pokémon: [[Stufful]]

title: salandit
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #757 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Poison/Fire Pokémon and has the ability [i]Corrosion[/i].

Salandit is a small, black Pokémon resembling a salamander or lizard. Its body is dark gray with a black head and feet. Along its back and down its tail is an orange-red line. 

Only female Salandit will evolve into [[Salazzle]].

Japanese name: [b]Yatōmori[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Shiinotic]]
Next Pokémon: [[Salazzle]]

body:

Lurantis is an insectoid Pokémon with some plant-like features. The top half of its head is pink, while the bottom half is white. It has light red eyes and two green antennae with a small green lump between them. 

It evolves from [[Fomantis]].

Japanese name: [b]Rarantesu[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Fomantis]]
Next Pokémon: [[Morelull]]

title: araquanid
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #752 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Water/Bug Pokémon. 

Araquanid is a fairly large spider-like Pokémon with a bubble of water surrounding its head. Its six legs are yellow-green for two-thirds of their length, and the final portions are dark blue. Each leg has an opaque bubble enveloping each joint.

It evolves from [[Dewpider]]

Japanese name: [b]Onishizukumo[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Dewpider]]
Next Pokémon: [[Fomantis]]

title: dewpider
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #751 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Water/Bug Pokémon.

Dewpider is a Pokémon resembling a spider. The most prominent feature of Dewpider is the water bubble that covers its head, which is anchored to the thorax by the means of three thin, green projections.

It evolves into [[Araquanid]].

Japanese name: [b]Shizukumo[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Mudsdale]]
Next Pokémon: [[Araquanid]]

title: toxapex
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #748 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Water/Poison Pokémon.
Toxapex is a primarily blue coloured Pokémon resembling a starfish. Its main body is very small, compared to its tentacles, which are used for its motion. Toxapex's main body is mostly suspended in mid-air due to the length of its tentacles.

It evolves from [[Mareanie]].

Japanese name: [b]Dohidoide[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Mareanie]]
Next Pokémon: [[Mudbray]]

title: mareanie
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #747 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Water/Poison Pokémon. 
Mareanie is a starfish-like Pokémon with a purple stalk-like body and ten drooping tentacles that resembles hair. It has a blue and purple color scheme, and what appears to be a gloomy expression. 
Its prey are [[Corsola]].

It evolves into [[Toxapex]].

Japanese name: [b]Hidoide[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Wishiwashi]]
Next Pokémon: [[Toxapex]]

title: charjabug
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #737 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Bug/Electric Pokémon that has the ability [i]Battery[/i].

Charjabug is a small, cuboid Pokémon resembling an insect. Its body consists of three square segments with two brown stubs on each side. 

Charjabug evolved from [[Grubbin]] and will eventually evolve into [[Vikavolt]] by level up at the [i]Vast Pony Canyon[/i]. 

Japanese Name: [b]Denjimushi[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Grubbin]]
Next Pokémon: [[Vikavolt]]

title: grubbin
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #736 in the National PokéDex, a Bug type Pokémon that has the ability [i]Swarm[/i]. 

Grubbin is a small, insectoid Pokémon. It has a white body with three nubs on either side resembling simple legs. There are two yellow spots on its side. 

It evolves into [[Charjabug]], then into [[Vikavolt]].

Japanese Name: [b]Agojimushi[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Gumshoos]]
Next Pokémon: [[Charjabug]]

title: toucannon
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #733 in the National PokéDex, a Normal/Flying dual-type Pokémon.
Toucannon is an avian Pokémon with black feathers and a prominent beak similar to a toucan's. The upper part of the beak has a black tip with three red bands gradually lightening in color toward the yellow base.

It evolves from [[Trumbeak]] and is the final evolution of [[Pikipek]].

Japanese name: [b]Dodekabashi[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Trumbeak]]
Next Pokémon: [[Yungoos]]

title: trumbeak
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #732 in the National PokéDex, a Normal/Flying dual-type Pokémon.
Trumbeak is an avian Pokémon with black feathers. It has a long beak that tapers to a sharp point. The majority of its beak is orange, changing to light red and then black at the tip. 

It evolves from [[Pikipek]] and evolves into [[Toucannon]].

Japanese name: [b]Kerarappa[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Pikipek]]
Next Pokémon: [[Toucannon]]

title: dartrix
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #723 in the National PokéDex, a Grass/Flying dual type Pokémon. 

It evolves from [[Rowlet]], the Grass starter of Generation VII and evolves into [[Decidueye]]. 

Dartrix is an avian Pokémon that resembles an owl. Most of its plumage is white, but it has dark brown feathers covering its head, shoulders, and back. 

Japanese Name: [b]Fukuthrow[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Rowlet]]
Next Pokémon: [[Decidueye]]

title: torracat
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #726 in the National PokéDex, a Fire-type Pokémon.
Torracat is a quadruped, feline Pokémon with black and reddish-orange markings. Its upper half is mostly black, while its lower half is mostly red-orange.

It evolves from [[Litten]], the Fire-starter Pokémon of Generation VII, and evolves into [[Incineroar]].

Japanese Name: [b]Nyaheat[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Litten]]
Next Pokémon: [[Incineroar]]

title: popplio
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #728 in the National PokéDex, a Water-type Pokémon and the Water starter of Generation VII.
Popplio is a pinniped Pokémon that is primarily blue. It has large eyes, a long, white snout with black whiskers, and round, pink nose. 

It evolves into [[Brionne]], then [[Primarina]].

Japanese name: [b]Ashimari[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Incineroar]]
Next Pokémon: [[Brionne]]

title: liquid_snake
body: Solid Snake's rival and twin brother. Also the main villain of Metal Gear Solid 1, making his first appearance in the series. He was born as part of the Les Enfants Terribles project, and always believed he was the inferior one to his brother [[Solid Snake]]. Voiced by Cam Clarke in North America, and by Ginga Banjou [銀河 万丈] in Japan.

title: jack_bright
body:
One of the most troublesome members of the [[SCP Foundation]], along with Dr. [[Alto Clef]] and Dr. [[Kondraki]].
He's been under the effect of the [[SCP-963]] after being killed while touching it - any person/animal/living thing that touches 963 is possesed by Bright's soul, effectively giving him immortality. He has at least two siblings.

h4.See also

* "Personnel Director Bright's Personnel File - The SCP Foundation":http://www.scp-wiki.net/dr-bright-s-personnel-file
* "The Things Dr Bright Is Not Allowed To Do At The Foundation":http://www.scp-wiki.net/the-things-dr-bright-is-not-allowed-to-do-at-the-foundation

title: solid_snake
body:
[b]Solid Snake[/b] is the protagonist of the [[Metal Gear (series)|Metal Gear series]] of stealth action video games. [spoiler]His real name isn't David. Part of the Les Enfants Terribles project, which makes him [[Big Boss]]' clone/son, the twin brother of [[Liquid Snake]], and the older brother of [[Solidus Snake]].[/spoiler]

A master of hand to hand combat and stealth techniques; sometimes resorting to a [[cardboard box]]. Also a heavy smoker, much like his father. He has saved the world from nuclear disasters on 3 occasions. Infiltrating Outer Heaven, Zanzibar, and Shadow Moses Island single handedly destroying 3 Metal Gear threats.

Voiced by "David Hayter":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Hayter in North America, and [[Ootsuka Akio]] in Japan.

title: qingming_festival
body:
The Qingming or Ching Ming Festival, also known as Tomb-Sweeping Day in English, is a traditional Chinese festival on the first day of the fifth solar term of the traditional Chinese lunisolar calendar. The holiday is associated with the consumption of [[qingtuan]], green dumplings made of glutinous rice and barley grass.

h4. See also
* [[qingtuan]]

h4. Links
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qingming_Festival

title: title_screen
body:
A screen introducing a [[video game]] before it can be played.

The [[copyright name|title]] of the game is often present, as well as a menu with items such as "New game", "Load game" and "Options".

title: douman_seiman
body:
For an artist, see [[dowman sayman]].

"Douman Seiman" is a line from the refrain of the song "Let's Go! Onmyouji" from the Power Instinct: Matrimelee soundtrack.

A CG-animated music video of this song was produced by the game company. Shortly thereafter, it was leaked to the Internet - [[NicoNico]], in particular - and from there it became a popular meme. Memetic mutation set in (e.g. [[Yabeno Hikomaro]]'s line, "Kuyokuyo suru na!" ("Don't brood on it!") was mondegreened as "Puyopuyo suru na!" ("Don't get soft and squishy!"))

Several other videos and songs have made reference to this video. One of the most notable is "Tsurupettan" by Silver Forest, which uses Kotohime's first sung part, modified slightly, as a bridge into the refrain. (It also used the "puyopuyo suru na!" meme above.)

Lead vocals: Yabeno Hikomaro
Bridge/other vocals: Kotohime
Backup vocals: Boushu Dancers

body:

Usually those who see his non-yukkuri work for the first time are surprised that he is actually good at drawing.

Joke names: 外出るのめんどくさい (lit. "going outside is too much bother"), かずみ (Kazumi)

title: the_legend_of_gluttony
body:
グラットン伝説 (The Legend of Gluttony aka. The Legend of Buront)

A series of [[Buront]] x [[Touhou]] [[crossover]] videos created by "'＜コ:ミ.'":http://www.nicovideo.jp/user/3787125 It's a distinct series from [[The Iron of Yin and Yang]]. In fact, it's one of the earliest [[Buront]] x [[Touhou]] crossovers, and is considered as a type of so-called "[[M.U.G.E.N]] stories."
This series contains very few touhou elements ~ only two characters, [[Hinanawi Tenshi]] and [[Nagae Iku]]. And their character settings are completely different from the [[Touhou]] canon.

h4.See also

* [[Ryu-san]] (protagonist)
* Iku-san ([[Nagae Iku]])
* [[Buront]]
* [[Hinanawi Tenshi]]
* [[The Iron of Yin and Yang]]

h4.See  also

* [[NicoNico]] MyList: http://www.nicovideo.jp/mylist/8739260

title: noroi_no_yakata
body:
呪いの館 (第一話) ("[i]Noroi no Yakata[/i]", "The Cursed Mansion [part.1]") 

A 1996 free game developed by Sankaku-Onigiri, and his son, Tomo-chan.  "A certain video":http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm1928803 uploaded in 2008 has popularized the game all over the [[NicoNico]]. It is notorious for the protagonist's weird death scene & cry. The nameless protagonist is often called "[[hiroshi_(noroi_no_yakata)|Hiroshi]]" because he looks like [[Nohara Hiroshi]] from [[Crayon Shin-chan]].

title: ouija
body: The ouija (wee-jah, or wee-jee), also known as a spirit board or talking board, is a flat board marked with the letters of the alphabet, the numbers 0–9, the words "yes", "no", "hello" (occasionally), and "goodbye", along with various symbols and graphics. It uses a small heart-shaped piece of wood or plastic called a planchette. Participants place their fingers on the planchette, and it is moved about the board to spell out words. "Ouija" is a trademark of Hasbro, Inc.,but is often used generically to refer to any talking board.

title: duke_b_rambert
body: A French knight who receives an invitation to the [[Toushinden]] tournament for a second chance to defeat [[Eiji Shinjo]], who had previously defeated him in an unrelated duel. Duke joins the second tournament [spoiler]because his former girlfriend is the villainness Uranus.[/spoiler]

title: kayin_amoh
body: [[Eiji Shinjo]]'s friend who studied swordplay with him for a number of years before leaving on a mission of revenge. Kayin's adopted father was killed by the previous tournament's champion, and Kayin joins the [[Toushinden]] to find that killer. [spoiler]He discovers it's Sho Shinjo, Eiji's older brother. Despite this, Kayin holds no hatred for Eiji.[/spoiler] After learning the truth, Kayin devotes himself to caring for his adopted daughter Naru Amoh, but then vanishes after the third tournament. [spoiler]If Naru's ending is seen in Toshinden 4, Kayin's spirit visits her, greatly implying that he died after leaving her.[/spoiler]

title: eiji_shinjo
body:
The main hero of the [[Toushinden]] series [spoiler]but becomes an antagonist in Toshinden 4.[/spoiler] Eiji is a hotheaded swordsman who has become infamous in the fighting world for his skill, despite his immaturity. He joins the tournament to find his older brother [[Sho Shinjo]]. Later, Eiji matures into an independent young man who can fend for himself against the toughest opponents, assisting in the downfall of the Himitsu Kessha's corrupt leaders.

[spoiler]Surprisingly, Eiji becomes the new head of the Himitsu Kessha, organizing the fourth tournament many years later to bring together the Four Divine Weapons. Subaru Shinjo is his nephew, who had joined the tournament to find Eiji.[/spoiler]

title: sho_shinjo
body: The mysterious older brother of [[Eiji Shinjo]]. Sho vanishes some time while Eiji is growing up; it's discovered that Sho joined a previous [[Toushinden]] tournament and won [spoiler]after killing Kayin Amoh's adoptive father[/spoiler], then worked for the Himitsu Kessha as an assassin (though it didn't seem to be his choice). Sho can be fought as an unlockable optional boss in the first three games. [spoiler]Subaru Shinjo is Sho's son, and the mother is assumed to be another assassin named Cupido, who likewise shares the same burdens of killing that Sho does.[/spoiler]

title: kotobuki_tsukasa
body: Character designer for various games and anime series such as [[Saber Marionette J]], [[VS Knight Lamune & 40 Fire]], [[Akihabara Dennou Gumi]] and [[Toushinden]]. He also did the art for [[Sword of the Dark Ones]].

title: sofia_(toushinden)
body:
A dominatrix-clad fighter in [[Toushinden]] who joins the tournament to regain her memories. [spoiler]She learns the Himitsu Kessha tampered with her memories so she wouldn't remember being the prototype for a killer whom the syndicate could control remotely via brainwashing.[/spoiler]

Sofia remains positive after this revelation and rebonds with her family to make new memories, but the second tournament is organized and she feels she must participate. [spoiler]Sofia meets the final version of the brainwashing experiment in another fighter named Chaos, whom she tries to save but ultimately cannot.[/spoiler]

Sofia's design and storyline are incredibly similar to [[Virtua Fighter]]'s [[Sarah Bryant]].

title: sneer
body:
While just as anger inducing as a [[smirk]], a sneer is a sign of absolute contempt. A sneer sends the message that the person sneering believes the target of their ire is so utterly pathetic that they want to laugh. It's an extreme expression and should be used sparingly.

If it's not a smile, use [[disdain]] or [[disgust]] instead. If the emotion presented is anger or hate, use [[scowl]] instead.

h4. Examples

* post #1642562
* post #1964708
* post #2039053
* post #2185534

title: tenuto
body:
A [[musical note]] that can mean either hold the note in question its full length (or longer, with slight rubato), or play the note slightly louder. The tenuto mark may alter either the dynamic or the duration of a note. Either way, the marking indicates that a note should receive emphasis.

The tenuto mark simply looks like a horizontal line placed directly above or below a musical note.

h4.See also

* [[accent mark]]
* [[fermata]]
* [[fortissimo]]
* [[staccato]]

title: fermata
body:
A [[musical note]] indicating that the note should be prolonged beyond its normal duration or note value would indicate. Exactly how much longer it is held is up to the discretion of the performer or conductor, but twice as long is common. A fermata looks like a bracket turned 90 degrees with a circle placed inside it, "like this":https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e7/Fermata_round.png.

h4.See also

* [[accent mark]]
* [[fortissimo]]
* [[staccato]]
* [[tenuto]]

title: kinoshita_hideyoshi
body:
One of the main characters of [[Baka to Test to Shoukanjuu]], voiced by [[Katou Emiri]] (JP) and Brina Palencia (EN).
[[Kinoshita Yuuko]] is his twin elder sister - and they look an awful lot alike, to the point where he confuses nearly everyone by his [[androgynous]] features and girly voice.

Has [[otoko_no_ko|his]] own onsen marked as "Hideyoshi" due to this, and was voted first place among all male characters and tenth among [b]FEMALE[/b] characters in a Japanese poll of light novel characters.

title: ako_(shinrabanshou)
body:
アコ (full title: 美少女剣士アコちゃん [i]Bishoujo Kenshi Ako-chan[/i])

Character from [[Shinrabanshou]]'s 2012 storyline, Daimaou to Yattsu no Pillar. A fake identity used by [[Ark Mateus]] when he is magically transformed into a human girl in order to disguise himself. Because of Ark's original gender and the fact that Ako's gender is officially given as "Female?", she is often portrayed as a [[otoko_no_ko|trap]] in fanart.

Ako's trap appeal garnered her enough popularity to win first place in the "other" gender category of the Shinrabanshou All-Stars Popularity Contest of 2014.

h4. Cards:

* Yabashira 057: "Bishoujo Kenshi Ako-chan":http://www.palusuke.com/list/eightpillar3/eightpillar057.html
* Yabashira 057: "Bishoujo Kenshi Ako-chan":http://www.palusuke.com/list/TopCharactersSelection/TopCharactersSelectionNo29.html (All-Stars winner card)

body:
A character from the anime [[K-ON!]]. Originally one of the no-name girls from season 2. However, her name was listed as "Eri" in the closed captioning, and based on a class list shown in the anime, her family name is Taki.

She has brown hair with a [[side ponytail]] on the left side. She sits in front of [[Tainaka Ritsu]] in class. In the class photo shoot - from the right side, she sat next to [[Manabe Nodoka]].

Eri likes cola, and is frequently accompanied by [[Satou Akane]].

title: wamuu
body:

title: eda_(black_lagoon)
body: In [[Black Lagoon]], Eda is a member of the "Rip-Off Church" or as it's more commonly known, the "Church of Violence." She and her superior, Sister Yolanda, sell guns to the various factions of Roanapur, and the Lagoon Company are a frequent customer. Eda and [[revy_(black_lagoon)|Revy]] have an adversarial kind of friendship with each other, and Eda constantly teases Revy about [[Okajima Rokuro|Rock]], which never fails to annoy Revy.

title: okajima_rokuro
body: In [[Black Lagoon]], Okajima Rokuro, or as he's more commonly known in Roanapur, "Rock," was a Japanese salaryman who was kidnapped by the Lagoon Company and then betrayed by his company, Asahi Heavy Industries, who sent a band of mercenaries to kill him. Rock has since joined his kidnappers, acting as the Lagoon Company's general negotiator. His idealism, his sense of morality and his willingness to settle things with words rather than guns often puts him at odds with the more violent and cynical [[revy_(black_lagoon)|Revy]].

title: chaka_(black_lagoon)
body: In [[Black Lagoon]], Chaka is an enforcer for the Washimine Group. He fancies himself a real "cowboy" and is fluent in English. Arrogant, cruel and sadistic, he is often seen as an idiot by his Yakuza peers. When [[Washimine Yukio]] becomes the boss of the group, he tries to take control of the leadership by kidnapping her with the help of a street gang, and ends up bringing down the wrath of both [[revy_(black_lagoon)|Revy]] and Yukio's protector [[Matsuzaki Ginji]] upon his head.

title: garcia_lovelace
body: In [[Black Lagoon]], [b]Garcia Fernando Lovelace[/b] is the only son of Diego Lovelace, a member of one of the thirteen richest families of South America. He winds up in the hands of the Lagoon Company when the Colombian-based Manisalera Cartel kidnaps him in an attempt to get to Diego's land, which prompts [[roberta_(black_lagoon)|Roberta]], the family's devoted head maid, to dust off her guns and mount a one-woman rescue mission.
other_names: ガルシア・フェルナンド・ラブレス

title: fabiola_iglesias
body: In [[Black Lagoon]], Fabiola Iglesias is a junior maid of the Lovelace family who answers directly to [[roberta_(black_lagoon)|Roberta]]. She is the only maid of the family whom Roberta has trained in combat, and handles herself surprisingly well for her youth and relative inexperience.
other_names: ファビオラ・イグレシアス

title: peter_pan_(character)
body:
Titular character of the British story [i][[Peter Pan]][/i]. Partner is the fairy Tinkerbell and rival is [[Captain Hook]].

A mischievous, functionally immortal young boy who lives on the island of Neverland. While he is adventurous and serves as leader of his group of "Lost Boys", he is also somewhat immature and forgetful to the point of completely forgetting a person if they've been gone long enough or died. He has the ability to fly while his shadow is still attached to him; without it, he's flightless. Likes hearing stories, and it's partially the reason why he takes [[Wendy Darling]] and her [[john_darling|two]] [[michael_darling|brothers]] to Neverland with him.

Known around London for crowing like a rooster on the rooftops at night and taking babies that have been out of their crib for more than a week. Depending on the adaptation, Peter can look like small child or an early adolescent.

title: star_gladiator
body:
A 1996 weapon-based 3D fighting game released by [[Capcom]] for the PlayStation-based ZN-1 arcade hardware. It was Capcom's first polygonal fighting game, preceding the [[Street Fighter EX (series)|original Street Fighter EX]] (which Capcom co-produced Arika) by a few months. The gameplay is pretty much the same as [[Namco]]/[[Bandai Namco]]'s [[Soulcalibur]] (2 slash buttons, a guard button, and a kick button).

title: gothicmade_(mecha)
body:
GOTHICMADE, abbreviated as GTM, are the [[mecha]] weapons that first appeared in [[Nagano Mamoru]]'s 2012 film [[Hana no Utame Gothicmade]].

They feature bizarre body shapes, with 2 spines and a long neck, plus large feet and hands relative to the small, thin torso. 
The biggest feature is the multitude of Z-shaped bent rail joints. In the story, these are called Twin Swing, and are the main source of GTMs' high combat capabilities, along with the Helios Armor & Harmoid Energy System.

When Nagano's [[Five Star Stories]] manga serialization returned in 2013 after a 9-year hiatus, he decided to replace all of the [[mortar_headd|Mortar Headds]] in the series with GTM.
Each type of MH was replaced with its respective GTM counterpart, and the MH, and its predecessor mecha called Machine Messaih, were completely purged from the FSS universe, history, and stories.

Furthermore, "Headliners", the formal, obsolete name of MH's knights(pilots), and "[[fatima_(five_star_stories)|Fatimas]]" were renamed to "Warcasters" and "AF (Automatic Flowers)", though the previous names remained as aliases.
GTMs are about one third larger than the MHs, and their technology and engine output are completely different.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article (Japanese)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%B4%E3%83%86%E3%82%A3%E3%83%83%E3%82%AF%E3%83%A1%E3%83%BC%E3%83%89

title: eiyuu_chronicle
body:
[i]Eiyuu Chronicle[/i] (Hero Chronicle) is an online turn-based simulation RPG created by "Success Corporation":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Success_%28company%29.

A player is a member of one of 5 countries in the game, with the various countries contending with one another. The game splits play into seasons, each of which last 3 months in the real world and represent 3 years in the game world.

One of the key features is that users have a high degree of freedom when creating their characters. A user can upload images of their character and specify their name, skills, equipment, background information, signature phrase, and more.

h4. Links

* "Eiyuu Chronicle homepage":http://www.success-corp.co.jp/software/general/au-chronicle/

title: noutenki_(kaiketsu_noutenki)
body:
Titular "hero" of [i][[Kaiketsu Noutenki]][/i], a series of short films parodying the 1977 live-action superhero show [i][[Kaiketsu Zubat]][/i].  The title translates roughly as "The Dashing Scatterbrain".

Played by producer Takeda Yasuhiro, Noutenki's alter ego is Ken Hayakawa, who shares his name and faux-cowboy attire with the hero of [i]Zubat[/i] but is an overweight, fanboyish type.  His hero costume is mainly pink and red, with a huge "No" (の) on the chest, and with a pom-pom on a wire poking out the top of his yellow helmet, adding to his silly appearance.

title: kaiketsu_noutenki
body:
A series of short films parodying the 1977 live-action superhero show [i][[Kaiketsu Zubat]][/i], made between 1982 and 1988 by Daicon Films, later to be known as [[Gainax]].  The title translates roughly as "The Dashing Scatterbrain".

The hero of the show, played by producer Takeda Yasuhiro, is Ken Hayakawa, who shares his name and faux-cowboy attire with the hero of [i]Zubat[/i] but is an overweight, fanboyish type.  His hero costume is mainly pink and red, with a huge "No" (の) on the chest, and with a pom-pom on a wire poking out the top of his yellow helmet, adding to his silly appearance.

Each episode's closing credits would feature outtakes/bloopers, especially those occurring with special effects.  The credits themselves would sometimes go out of focus, possibly as a deliberate emphasis on the amateur nature of the work.

title: sylvie_paula_paula
body: A new character introduced in [[The King of Fighters XIV]], a member of the "Official Invitation Team". Inspired by the Japanese idol Kyary Pamyu Pamyu, Sylvie has electromagnetic powers she can use to shock and throw people around with. Sylvie was actually a former agent of the NESTS cartel, but her powers did not awaken until after the conglomerate fell apart. She was invited to the KOF tournament after winning several underground fights.

title: cockatrice
body:
[i]A cockatrice is a mythical beast, essentially a two-legged dragon or serpent-like creature with a rooster's head.[/i] - "from the Wikipedia introduction":[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cockatrice&oldid=768652790]

It's sometimes also portrayed as a giant rooster with either a snake's tail or a snake's frontal part as a tail. It was believed that its gaze was fatal.

title: tatsumiya_mana
body:
龍宮 真名
Age: November 17, 1988

From [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].
Seat 18 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a [[miko]] and runs a shrine on campus. She is also in the Biathlon Club. She is [[gunkata|very skilled]] in gun combat with a hint of magic. This pertains to her jobs as an exorcist and mercenary.

She carries a [[pactio|pactio card]] from a previous master and has a number of impressive skills, a notable one being her "Demon-Eye".

h6. Appearance:

* [[long hair|Long]] [[black hair|black]] or [[brown hair]] w/long [[sidelocks]] in two red [[hair ribbon|ribbons]].
* [[yellow eyes|Golden eyes]].
* [[Dark skin]], due to her being half-Puerto Rican/half-Japanese.

title: midorikawa_yuhata
body:
Midorikawa Yuhata is a female character from [[Sidonia No Kishi]], a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] series. She has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] in a [[bob cut]] and [[green eyes]]. She has an older brother, [[Midorikawa Izumo]]. 

When she's not working with real [[morito_(sidonia_no_kishi)|Morito]] mechs, she likes to build [[miniature]] figures from [[model kits]]. 

Her trainee number is TS-256. She is later transferred to the command staff due to her tactical acumen.

title: takanashi_rikka
body:
Female lead of [[Chuunibyou demo Koi ga Shitai!]]. 

She has one [[blue eyes|blue]] left [[blue eyes|eye]] while her right eye, which she calls the "Wicked Eye" is covered in an [[eyepatch]]. This eyepatch is used to prevent the "Wicked Eye" from glowing too much, although this "Wicked Eye" is simply a [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[glowing eye]] (it's actually a colored [[contact lens]]) much like [[Sakamoto Mio]] from [[Strike Witches]], hence revealing the [[heterochromia]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] dark [[blue hair]] which is [[one_side_up|tied up on one side]]. 

She wears a female version of her [[school_uniform|school's uniform]]: a red [[plaid]] skirt, an [[ascot]], and a [[blazer]]-like blouse.

title: mikogami_sayo
body:
御子神 紗夜（振り仮名：みこがみ さよ, ロマン字：Mikogami Sayo）, a character from the mobile escape game [[Youkai Yashiki Kara No Dasshutsu]]（妖怪屋敷からの脱出）.

[spoiler]In the final chapter, she faints at the basement after empowering the sword required to defeat the ushioni（牛鬼）. After the ushioni is defeated, the yashiki collapses after the protagonist places the final orb and escapes, presumably killing her. In the true ending which is unlocked if players final all 25 youkai (21 are visible while 4 are hidden), the youkai will allow the protagonist to return back to the yashiki but with a time limit (indicated by 8 flames which will disappear one by one over time). At there, she can be rescued by the protagonist if players go back to the basement, click on her and escape from the yashiki within the time limit.[/spoiler]

title: suzuhara_yayoi
body:
鈴原 弥生（振り仮名：すずはら やよい, ロマン字：Suzuhara Yayoi）, a nurse from the mobile escape game [[Shinrei Byouin Kara No Dasshutsu]]（心霊病院からの脱出）.

[spoiler]In the normal ending, she is killed by a zombie nurse while protecting the main character who is a young boy (he escapes from the hospital after that). In the true ending which is unlocked if players obtain all the journal pages (one in each chapter after the game is completed once) then give the completed journal book to her in the final chapter before clicking on the door to exit, she seems to survive the attack from the zombie nurse and escapes with the main character. Years later, the main character is killed in an accident. She disappears upon receiving news of his death.[/spoiler]

title: hiiragi_tsuyoto
body:
[i][[Shounen Hollywood]][/i] character. The viewpoint character of the novel and a member of the original Shounen Hollywood. Nicknamed "God" and is usually referred to as such by his former groupmates. 

Actual name Sakuragi Kouji (桜木広司), Tsuyoto is a 32-year old man who lied about his age in order to become an idol, passing himself off as a 17 year old boy. Becomes the owner of Hollywood Tokyo following the death of the old proprietor and the producer of the second Shounen Hollywood 15 years later. Is always referred to as "Forever 17" when asked about his age as "God".

title: hovercraft
body:
A [b]hovercraft[/b], also known as an [b]air-cushion vehicle[/b] or [b]ACV[/b], is a craft capable of travelling over land, water, mud, ice, and other surfaces. Hovercraft are hybrid vessels operated by a pilot as an aircraft rather than a captain as a marine vessel.

Hovercraft use blowers to produce a large volume of air below the hull that is slightly above atmospheric pressure. The pressure difference between the higher pressure air below the hull and lower pressure ambient air above it produces lift, which causes the hull to float above the running surface. 

For stability reasons, the air is typically blown through slots or holes around the outside of a disk- or oval-shaped platform, giving most hovercraft a characteristic rounded-rectangle shape. Typically this cushion is contained within a flexible "skirt", which allows the vehicle to travel over small obstructions without damage.

title: guardian_(elsword)
body: [[chung_seiker|Chung]]'s starting character class. His hair is short with brown streaks. His [[full armor|full-body armor]] Freiturnier has large pauldrons, a small blue necktie, white armor and white thigh-length [[greaves]]. In berserk mode, his helmet has very long blue hair.

title: fury_guardian_(elsword)
body: One of [[chung_seiker|Chung]]'s character classes. His hair is the same as the Guardian class but slightly longer. His [[full armor|full-body armor]] Freiturnier has some black fringe on the shoulders, white armor, a small portion of his blue shirt extending out from the bottom of his chest plate, and thigh-length white [[greaves]]. In berserk mode, the blue hair on his helmet is long and spiky.

title: shooting_guardian_(elsword)
body: One of [[chung_seiker|Chung]]'s character classes. His hair is short and spiky. His [[full armor|full-body armor]] Freiturnier has a blue scarf with a red underside, white armor, black pants, and white thigh-length greaves. The main difference between this class and [[deadly chaser (elsword)|Deadly Chaser]] is that Chung uses the light pistol Silver Shooter in his right hand and his cannon the Destroyer in his left. In berserk mode, the [[blue hair]] on his helmet is short and spiky.

title: shelling_guardian_(elsword)
body: One of [[chung_seiker|Chung]]'s character classes. His hair is long and tied into a low ponytail. His [[full armor|full-body armor]] Freiturnier has pauldrons, white armor, a blue [[surcoat]] beneath his chest plate, black pants, and thigh-length white [[greaves]]. In berserk mode, the [[blue hair]] on his helmet is spiky at the top and trails into a long thin ponytail.

title: kagura_maki
body:
神楽 マキ (かぐら マキ)

[[The King of Fighters]] character

Maki is [[Kagura Chizuru]]'s long deceased twin elder sister, also of the Yata clan serving as the head of said clan. Both twins act as the mid-bosses of [[The King of Fighters 2003]] with Maki acting as a shadow created by Chizuru's mirror.

Not much is known about her, except she was killed trying to protect the seal of Orochi against the leader of the Hakkesshu, [[Goenitz]]. The Maki who appears in King of Fighters 2003 is an illusion created by the Mirror of Yata by Chizuru, who was, at the time, under the control of [[Botan (KOF)|Botan]], a member of Those from the Past.

She fights in the same way her sister does, except now she can send multiple shadow clones of herself to attack.

title: clark_still
body:
A character from [[SNK]]'s [[Ikari (game)|Ikari]], [[The King of Fighters]], and [[Metal Slug]] series.

He appears as one of the protagonists of Ikari alongside [[Ralf Jones|Ralf]].

He is well-known for the Super Argentinian Backbreaker throw, in which he tosses his opponent upward and catches him for a knee backbreaker.

title: ralf_jones
body:
A character from [[SNK]]'s [[Ikari (game)|Ikari]], [[The King of Fighters]], and [[Metal Slug]] series.

He appears as one of the protagonists of Ikari alongside [[Clark Still|Clark]].

He is well-known for the Vulcan Punch, which he delivers a barrage of rapid-fire punches that explode when one of the punches make contact.

title: jhun_hoon
body:
Pronounced "John-Hoon", a recurring member of the Korean team after his debut in [[The King of Fighters '99]]. He is the friendly [[rivalry|rival]] of [[Kim Kaphwan]]. He was originally conceptualized to be "a veteran friendly character" with a Kim inspired moveset.

His Tae Kwon Do style is similar but different from Kim's. Jhun is a unique character because he can actively switch between three fighting stances, counting his starting one. The other two are called Hawk Style and Eagle Style, Jhun can even perform specials that are unique to these stances.

Voiced by Ichijou Kazuya.

title: igniz_(kof)
body:
Final boss of [[The King of Fighters 2001]]. He is 56 years old although his beauty makes him appear much younger. His handsome and youthful appearance was specifically created at the sponsors' request. He becomes the leader of NESTS after he kills his father (funnily named Nests). He is voiced by [[Wakamoto Norio]]. 

Igniz hosts the KOF 2001 tournament in hopes of becoming a new god, deciding to test his new found power against the finalists. His hopes were short-lived when he is defeated. Cursing his failure and declaring himself a demon instead, Igniz attempts to destroy those who oppose him by plummeting NESTS' main headquarters out of orbit. However, the fortunate passengers in the falling station survive the heat inside it (apparently thanks to Ron). Igniz's death signals the end of the NESTS cartel and its saga.

title: winston_(overwatch)
body:
[i]"Imagination is the essence of discovery."[/i]

Real Name: Winston
Age: 29
Occupation: Scientist, Adventurer
Residence: Horizon Lunar Colony (formerly); Watchpoint: Gibraltar

A tank-class character in [[Overwatch]]. A super-intelligent, genetically engineered gorilla, Winston is a brilliant scientist and a champion for humanity's potential. When he loses his temper, Winston becomes a raging ape. In his off-time, he enjoys peanut butter and bananas. He designed the chronal accelerator for [[tracer_(overwatch)|Tracer]] to fix her chronal disassociation.

h4. Limited event skins

* [[Wukong Winston]]

h4. External links

* "Overwatch wiki":[http://overwatch.gamepedia.com/Winston]

title: elisabeth_blanctorche
body:
[[The King of Fighters]] character.

Her initial character concept was to be the rival to [[Ash Crimson|Ash]] though developers decided to change her importance into a "leading lady" character. Her earlier design resembled a tougher modern-day equestrian including a short whip-they kept the whip as they liked the idea of short, quick movements. Developers also describe her fighting style as "orthodox with subtle tricks [to it]" despite her minimal moveset.

Elisabeth is the last known remaining Blanctorche, a family of nobles in France who supposedly protect the innocent. She is a childhood friend of Ash Crimson and they were raised in the same mansion together. She used to act as his older sister figure, until a fire burned down the mansion and many of her clansmen to the ground. As the sole member of the clan, she lives with her butler, Jacques, near the remains of her family's home.

She initially invites [[Nikaidou Benimaru]] and [[Duo Lon]] to France to reveal that she knows of the betrayal of Ron and the burning of the Hizoku village. They inform her of Ash's theft of [[Kagura Chizuru|Kagura Chizuru's]] mirror and she decides to join them. With the trio banded with the interest to take down Ash, they form the Rival Team and she eventually scolds Ash for seeming to forsake their mission. Though surprised by the youth's new powers, she swears to stop him in her team's ending.

Before meeting with Duo Lon and [[Shen Woo]], she revisits the burned down mansion where she and Ash spent their childhood with a handful of photographs from the area in her hand. During her meeting with her guests, she becomes aware of their intents to join the King of Fighters tournament with her and Ash's location in Paris. Although she just missed him, Elisabeth knows that he was there and fortifies her will to stop him. She reunites with Ash in the final act of the tournament only moments after Ash erases Saiki from existence. She yells her protest to his selfish decision, stating that she wanted to bring Ash back home with her. When he disappears with his apologies, Elisabeth mourns over the only memento he left behind: his headband.

She attacks with a short ranged [[riding crop]]. She also uses magical light powers to trick and trap others.
other_names: エリザベート・ブラントルシュ

title: ogura_eisuke
body:
おぐら えいすけ

Ogura Eisuke, also credited as "Ogura Eiichi" or "Ogura", is a graphic designer and illustrator hired by [[SNK]] in 1996 and continued to work for the team in Brezasoft and SNK-Playmore.

Best known for his art on [[Neo Geo Battle Coliseum]] and the [[The King of Fighters]] [[the King of Fighters XII|XII]] and [[the King of Fighters XIII|XIII]].

His art uses a variety of neutral gray tones and colors to create a bold contrast with the composition's negative space. He uses countless amounts of brush strokes -noticeably more than his colleagues - to accomplish one piece; magnified images of his work will reveal this to the viewer. He also critiques [[Hiroaki (KoF)|Hiroaki]] on his work, particularly on his efforts for detail and coloring.

title: yamazaki_ryuuji
body:
山崎 竜二 (やまざき りゅうじ)

A character from [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series.

He once idolized a yakuza and eventually became one himself.

It was revealed in [[The King of Fighters '97]] that Yamazaki is one of the Orochi Hakkesshu. Even though an Orochi Hakkesshu member's duty is to resurrect Orochi, Yamazaki shows little to no interest in doing so. He just wants to live his life as a criminal.

He fights using dirty brawling tactics, such as kicking sand into an opponent's eye, and his always present [[knife]]. He can also stretch his left arm like a snake for extra range and turn his right arm into a [[drill]] (but this drill can only be seen in one of his (Super) Desperation Moves).

title: adelheid_bernstein
body:
Often shortened as "Adel", the son of the late [[Rugal Bernstein]], and [[brother and sister|brother]] to Rugal's daughter [[Rose Bernstein|Rose]].

The siblings reside on an airship called "Sky Noah". In [[The King of Fighters 2003]], he would challenge fighters there at the behest of his sister. His story in [[The King of Fighters XI]] implies that he faced the Ikari Warriors Team and was defeated by them. He peacefully chats with [[Heidern]] and explains that he is only following his father's legacy. In his ending for the game, he seems to appear regretful for his actions and yells at his sister for insulting his opponents.

The Console Edition of [[The King of Fighters XIII]] reveals more of Adel's cooperation with Heidern (in which he addresses him as "Colonel Heidern") as he tries to help the forces of good suppress the evil plans of Those from the Past. When Rose is finally freed, he reassures his sister he would punish those responsible for her subjugation.

His style is very similar to his father Rugal's. Unlike his father, his moves are faster and is also easier to chain. On the other hand, his moves are significantly weaker in priority.
